title: Can I upgrade my laptop RAM?
body: My mate said most laptops use the same size RAM cards or w/e and so I could get the stronger cards out of my other trashed laptop and simply swap them out with the ones in my current laptop, I am a full blown ret4rd when it comes to PC things but I was wondering if this is in fact possible?

replies.body: yes but it will cost more on most occasions then buying a new one

> [{quoted}](name=Mar3thyu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nnmzOrfs,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-02T06:17:08.460+0000)
>
> yes but it will cost more on most occasions then buying a new one

Luckily I have the ram cards available from my old laptop already so I don't have to buy any.

> [{quoted}](name=Niji,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nnmzOrfs,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-02-02T06:18:58.880+0000)
>
> Luckily I have the ram cards available from my old laptop already so I don't have to buy any.

well if they are the same specs just have more ram then yes they are usable otherwise you will have to buy some more
Most laptops have stickers with specs on them so you don't have to open them to find out if they're the same.

Yes.

edit: as long as they're the same ddr.

> [{quoted}](name=Jakiron,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nnmzOrfs,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-02-02T06:14:10.065+0000)
>
> Yes.
> 
> edit: as long as they're the same ddr.

Cool beans now all I need is one of those tiny little fkn screwdrivers, I can easily learn the difference between ddrs now I just have to hope both laptops have the same type.
